intro: Cephaelis emetica, commonly known as the emetic celandine, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa and southern Asia. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows to a height of 1–3 meters. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Cephaelis emetica is known for its medicinal properties, though it can be toxic if ingested in large quantities.
